question: A.01 [1.0 point] Which ONE of the following best describes the importance of a negative temperature coefficient of reactivity?

answers.answer: a. An increase in reactor power causes an increase in fuel burnup which results in a positive reactivity addition, causing the power increase to slow or stop.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: DOE Fundamentals Handbook, Nuclear Physics & Reactor Theory, Volume 2, Module 3, p. 28

answers.answer: b. An increase in reactor power causes an increase in fuel temperature which results in a negative reactivity addition, causing the power increase to slow or stop.
answers.feedback: Correct. Reference: DOE Fundamentals Handbook, Nuclear Physics & Reactor Theory, Volume 2, Module 3, p. 28

answers.answer: c. An increase in reactor power causes an increase in fuel temperature which results in a positive reactivity addition, causing the power increase to slow or stop.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: DOE Fundamentals Handbook, Nuclear Physics & Reactor Theory, Volume 2, Module 3, p. 28

answers.answer: d. An increase in reactor power causes an increase in fuel burnup which results in a negative reactivity addition, causing the power increase to slow or stop.

question: A.04 [1.0 point] Which ONE of the following is the definition of reactivity?

answers.feedback: Correct. Reference: Burn, Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, Section 1.3.1, p. 1-5
